intro: Hieracium doratolepium, commonly known as the purple meadowhawk, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring moist, well-drained soils. It produces small, purple to pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually basal and have a rough, hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
